meanings.definition: Retines: plural noun form of retine, meaning the sensory cells in the retina of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The retines in the eye help us see different colors.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the retines to understand how vision works.
meanings.sent3: The retines in the eye throw a party every time we look at something bright.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was a canvas, with retines painting vivid pictures of the world.
meanings.sent5: The retines are like tiny artists capturing the beauty of the world on the canvas of our eyes.

meanings.definition: Retines: verb form of retine, meaning to line or cover with a retine.
meanings.sent1: She carefully retines the edges of the painting to give it a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The artist retines the frame of the mirror to add a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: He retines his notebook with colorful stickers to make it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The garden was retined with fairy lights, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The tailor retines the dress with intricate lace, making it look exquisite.

meanings.definition: Retines: adjective form of retine, meaning pertaining to or resembling a retine.
meanings.sent1: The retines pattern on the fabric gives it a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The lampshade has a retines design that casts beautiful shadows.
meanings.sent3: Her retines shoes always attract compliments wherever she goes.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in retines hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The retines glow of the fireflies lit up the garden like a fairy tale.
